ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Depends on the student. I would only recommend this to students highly interested and proficient in programming and computation.
This class is essential to Computational Biologists. I would encourage students to take it, and to stay in close contact with the TAs to ensure comprehension of homework and assignments.

I would recommend this course because it is a good way to learn about SVD, next-gen sequencing, proteomics, RNAseq, ChIPseq, alignment, and molecular dynamics. However, the better lectures were those that provided an understanding of a technology in a survey manner.
Not easy if you don't know much about programming and SVD. But you can learn a lot if you stick to it.
I would recommend this course to students who have already taken introductory bioinformatics courses and are previously familiar with the topics covered.
This class is basically a survey class of various bioinformatics subtopics. I would recommend it.
Not in it's current state, even though I think some of the lectures were very good.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It very slightly de-mystified the inner workings of bioinformatics programs for me.
This course gave me a comprehensive introduction to many topics I will need for research. I certainly learned much in this class.

I think I mostly learned about bioinformatic technologies that most people just pick up from being in a lab. However, this course provided an overview that is very accessible. I now feel prepared to read papers on a variety of bioinformatic areas and have at least a basic grasp of the methods that are commonly used.
Because the course covered a large variety of topics in various subfields of bioinformatics, I thought it was very helpful.
The course helped me decide what topics I like and dislike in bioinformatics, which helped me make my decision about which lab to join.
